DOC.criteria: Adults relative risk ( RR ) > 1.5 develop cardiovascular disease ( CVD ) base present least one recognise risk factor CVD : total cholesterol ( TC ) > 6.0 mmol/l HDL cholesterol ( HDLC ) ≤ 1.0 mmol/l male , ≤ 1.3 mmol/l female Glucose ≥ 6 mmol/l Stage 1 hypertension i.e . systolic BP ≥ 140 mmHg , diastolic BP ≥ 90 mmHg BMI 2835 kg/m2 waist > 102 cm male > 84 cm female Adults first degree relative either history premature CVD age onset young 55 father , son brother younger 65 mother , daughter sister , type 2 diabetes . suffer myocardial infarction/stroke past 12 month diabetic ( diagnosed fasting glucose > 7 mmol/l ) suffer endocrine disorder suffer renal bowel disease history choleostatic liver pancreatitis drug treatment hyperlipidaemia , hypertension , inflammation hypercoagulation history alcohol abuse planning weight reduce regime take fish oil , fatty acid vitamin mineral supplement pregnant , lactate plan pregnancy smoker
